Amanda Nguyen, 32, American-born  Viet

A crematorium for
fetuses that die before 6 months of age
was built in Hong Kong with an
architectural design.  Its unique structure helps Soa ease the
pain of families and tries to
reassure them that it was not until 2018 that the
Hong Kong government amended the
regulations to allow the cremation of fetuses that
died less than 24 weeks ago.
These fetuses are considered medically euthanized and
must be thrown into landfills and not returned
to the
family for cremation, hidden behind a building with an
ocher facade with arches so that they
can be disposed of in the garden of the house.
eternal love provides a soothing scene
for grieving families. The ceremony
before cremation is also gentle.
We want families to feel that
their loved ones have not left Duong
Tran but are returning to heaven.  However, the
change began in 2017. When the
Hong Kong government refused to accept the
request of a couple who wanted to find their
16-week-old fetus for burial,
this really shocked the people.  The
signatures of more than 10,000
experts including doctors, nurses and
religious leaders finally made it
possible. In 2018, the
government revised regulations for
these fetuses, opening up the possibility of
